item.title: My Learning Java Diary
item.dc:creator: @ownagesbot ownagesbot
item.description:
@ownagesbot wrote:

Yep same, the worst thing is not knowing what something does, I always like to fully understand everything otherwise it really bugs me. I like to comment every line of code sometimes, just to re-ensure myself that I understand it all (also sometimes helps fault find etc.)

Read full topic

item.title: My Learning Java Diary
item.dc:creator: @Mr.Chris Mr.Chris
item.description:
@Mr.Chris wrote:

Yeh, if a book doesn’t explain it throughly to me, and how to do it and what for, I will have trouble actually using it, and have to refer to it every time I think I should use it.

Read full topic

item.title: My Learning Java Diary
item.dc:creator: @The_Un-Named The Un-Named
item.description:
@The_Un-Named wrote:

I haven’t read the book but I’ve took a look at java for dummies, mainly because it explains things as they are not just “do this, type that, bla bla bla”, although I’m sure a lot of books do this but then some samples on mopar don’t do this.

Read full topic

item.title: My Learning Java Diary
item.dc:creator: @Mr.Chris Mr.Chris
item.description:
@Mr.Chris wrote:

ownagesbot:

If you need any help with the chapters you learned on day 3 just ask, it’s by far some of the simplest stuff in java, I think the book is probably just complicating it.

I’m almost sure it is xD I re-read the chapter, and I’m starting to understand it more now. What the main problem was, was my personal lack of knowledge of what I learned on day one. It’s all sorted now.

Thanks owanges :):)[br][size=1]Posted on: 10-01-2007, 18:00:27[/size][hr]Added day 4*[br][size=1]Posted on: 10-01-2007, 19:38:45[/size][hr]Day 5 update

Read full topic

item.title: My Learning Java Diary
item.dc:creator: @Cheesehunk Cheesehunk
item.description:
@Cheesehunk wrote:

Keep up the good work. Your dedication is inspiring. Maybe next holidays I get or something I will do this, not time for it know. However, I’m sure you’re schedule is almost as hectic as mine, assuming you are older than me. Keep up the hard work.

Read full topic

item.title: My Learning Java Diary
item.dc:creator: @Mr.Chris Mr.Chris
item.description:
@Mr.Chris wrote:

'Tis good

Thanks for the comments Ollie

Thanks ownagesbot. I’m very detirmined to learn Java, yet I’m in no rush to do so. I like to keep a steady pace that I can happily learn at. If something gets too hard for, I’ll keep trying until I get it right.

Thanks again It’s good motivation xD <3

Read full topic

item.title: My Learning Java Diary
item.dc:creator: @ownagesbot ownagesbot
item.description:
@ownagesbot wrote:

The saying “don’t run before you can walk” pops to mind.
That’s exactly what Mr.Chris is doing, he’s learning to walk before running.
Once he’s got the foundations sure, he can wander off from the book and try new stuff (I recommend you do this. However I highly recommend you to keep on reading the book as you are doing ;)).

I’m really behind you, I love the fact your a good enthusiastic new programmer. I love the fact your learning, it’s great, keep up the good work ;).

And when you do get bored, or hit a hole (which you will, java seems to throw shit at you), just remember, no pain no gain.
It’s the same with most things, but keep going work through it and believe me it’ll be rewarding

Read full topic

item.title: My Learning Java Diary
item.dc:creator: @Javacisnotrecognized _^_
item.description:
@Javacisnotrecognized wrote:

Aw, I’m sorry that I act that way, and I’ll be the first to admin I’m an ameture at most things, but since

[quote=“Ollie, post:12, topic:45695”][quote author=Javacisnotrecognized link=topic=63478.msg754561#msg754561 date=1168393589]
Well, since you are one of the few people on this forum who has good judgement, I suppose your method will work fine. But don’t underestimate the power of just cannonballing right into something - I did that starting with RS2 private servers with NO Java knowlege at all and in under 2 weeks realized just how shitty they are designed
[/quote]

hence your current java knowlege.

Mr. Chris, Gratz your coming a long way. you are doing it correctly. javac did it a gay way dont listen. continue with your work[/quote]

I don’t really care about what you think anymore.

Read full topic

item.title: My Learning Java Diary
item.dc:creator: @Ollie Ollie
item.description:
@Ollie wrote:

Javacisnotrecognized:

The source is you.

i actually find it quite hilarious the way you think you know java, im not saying that i do. if anything i have a vauge knowlege of it.

and excuse me? the source is me. i agree, there is some topics which i have no clue on. aka history and biochemical genetics but hey? thats life, not one person can know everything. and if you think you do, your a bigger fool then i had ever imagined.
[me=Ollie]out[/me]
